Package pulse.input

Class InterpolationDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.input.InterpolationDataset
  • public class InterpolationDataset
extends java.lang.Object
    An InterpolationDataset stores data in a List of DataEntry<Double,Double> objects (each containing a 'key' and a 'value') and provides means to interpolate between the 'values' using the 'keys'. This is used mainly to interpolate between available data for thermal properties loaded in tabular representation, e.g. the density and specific heat tables.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      InterpolationDataset()
      Creates an empty InterpolationDataset.

    • Method Detail

      • previousTo

        public ImmutableDataEntry<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> previousTo​(double key)
        Iterates over the List of DataEntry objects to find one that has the closest getKey() < key value to the argument key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key, which is the upper bound for the search.
        Returns:
        a DataEntry object, satisfying the conditions above.

      • interpolateAt

        public double interpolateAt​(double key)
        Provides an interpolated value at key based on the available data in the DataEntry List.

        The interpolation is linear, i.e. result = k*key + b, where k and b are the parameters of the linear function calculated based on the value of the adjacent DataEntry objects. The adjacent DataEntries are calculated using the previousTo method. When found, a simple set of equations (2x2) is solved to calculate the k and b values, which are then substituted in the linear equation.

        Parameters:
        key - the argument, at which interpolation needs to be done (e.g. temperature)
        Returns:
        a double, representing the interpolated value
        See Also:
        previousTo(double)

      • add
